Uuummmmmm..........I've had some of the best pizza in the state of AZ!  THIS PLACE JUST TRUMPED THEM ALL!!!!!!!  So fresh, so high quality and cooked to perfection. I've only tried The Geppetto and it was MIND BLOWING. Soooooooo Goooood!  A toasted marshmallow milkshake for dessert is REQUIRED!  Class dismissed!
i enjoyed the pizza here.  Wood burning stove. They need to add grilled chicken to the menu though. The waiter attemptes to get us chicken from the salad side but I think he forgot.

What a gem! I wanted delivery and they didn't offer it. I saw the five star rating and thought what the heck lets go see what this is all about. The service was off the chart in excellence. The food was even better.A very pleasant surprise across the board. Don't miss the experience.

Really enjoyed this place and would agree with other reviewers that it is solid wood fired pizza. Enjoyed the zucchini cakes and the gem pizza. Lots of delicious sounding options on the menu (hard to decide!) and my husband approved of the beer list. Very friendly service from both the hostess and waiter.

Came here after a Frank Lloyd Wright Taliesin West tour because it was kind of close. Thrillest Phoenix had this place on their "Top 10 Pizza Places in Phoenix" so I figured it'd be good.  AND IT WAS. I'm pretty sure our waiter's name was Cole and he was really awesome. Brought out an extra plate because I had mentioned wanting to split the pizza with my dad. Also gave recommendations to my mom who wasn't sure what to order. He even offered to split the check (I was with extended family members).  Short version: Great Neapolitan style pizza!
Baller Pizza. Don't let them sit you in the corner though.

I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the pizza here. Definitely one of the best brick oven pizzas I've had in Scottsdale! Even though it was very crowded when we dined there, the staff was as helpful as possible. Had the Wood Roasted Vegetable and the Scientist and both were outstanding, I could not stop eating them. Highly recommend!
Apps were good.  Pizza was just so so.  A little bland .. :(

Same good pizza, love the gem!! I think the guy that works the bar has a few himself. but really, good food good service and if you don't want anyone to see you, you can call your order in and they are pretty fast

Tried to call in a carry out order many times here and it is a total joke. The phone goes into a recording, and when someone does answer, you get cut off. Too bad because the pizza is good.  When we eat in, service is hit or miss. The only time that they can give you good service is when the place is empty. This place is completely unorganized. I have to say that is is the worst operated pizza place I have ever been to.
Excellent pizzan and salads!!! So fresh and delicious. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality :)  great crust!

Don't go if you are hungry because they are so slow you will be starving by the time you get your food. 45 minutes from order to delivery of our pizza to our table.  I think it was good pizza but we were so hungry we were ready to eat the napkins. Anything would have tasted good.
I'm a big fan of Tuscany / Lazio pizzas, and this place comes pretty close to recreating it. If you eat dominos or barros, this place is not for you.

Very disappointed. The pictures on the website for the "Gem pizza" are quite deceiving. Our pizza had less than half the toppings than the pictures show.  The crust might as well have been a flatbread as it was hard and tough to chew through. All this for $17.00 WOW!!!  My husband ordered a glass of wine which came in a small 'juice' glass....really? They only charged $10.00 for that!!! At these prices I would think that they could afford wine glasses? I saw they had champagne glasses at another table :(   If you really want good food I would look elsewhere.) Last time to go here. Cannot recommend. Diogorno Tastes better with more toppings!!!! :)

Dear lord! So our company had its Christmas luncheon here last Friday, So glad I got to have this pizza again!   The restaurant itself is small and narrow but very cute and was able to accommodate our group of 12.   For a starter I got the meatballs, and had offered to share them with the people sitting around me. I wish I hadn't, they were Soho tasty!   For a pizza I ordered the Gem and had them add some green olives to it. AMAZING!   MY bosses wife ordered the Kensington and offered to let me try it. I normally don't like white pizza, but it looked interesting with the arugula piled high on it. But ones I bit into it I had a food gasam in my mouth! Under the arugula was FIGS!!! Seriously people, who puts figs on a pizza???? Lamp does, and thank god they do because I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since I took the last bite! I will FOR SURE be making the 40+ drive up to this place from my house and dragging my husband along as he HAS to try this pizza!!! Just amazing!

Friend been telling me about this place for a while up where he lives says its like Bianco.  Like Bianco you know I have to try this place. Had the Kicker Pizza he liked it so much we ordered two.  Let me tell you it was GREAT. The chilies were the perfect heat with all the other flavors going on.  The Beer Prices are very good to.   Already been back before I wrote this review.

This place is consistent with food & always excellent service. My newest fav pizza is the geppetto. I still always get the eggplant as a starter, I am obsessed. This place is great, go early because it's small & the wait can be rough when busy.

I love Lamp.  I'm thrilled that it's in my neck of the woods too!  This is such a great place for 'upscale pizza.'  It's delicious, the service is super friendly and warm, and it's always high on my list of weekly places to spend our dining out dollars.  We love to dine-in, enjoy a bottle of wine and wait for our wood-fired pizza!  We love Lamp!

Ok we loved it.  Upsides: Chewy crust. The white sausage pizza had Carmelized onion relish....perfectly sweet balance. (and I dislike sausage pizza). The white mushroom was also great...lots of fresh mushrooms! Zucchini cakes TO DIE FOR. Also, fig and goat cheese with mint bruschetta was fab. We also LOVED the white beam arugula salad. Frankly, there was nothing we didn't really enjoy. Great pizza for those of us too far north to drive to Bianco.  Also, we had great service.   Downsides: it's loud in there. They tried to seat us back by bathroom, it was too loud so we moved up front for a slightly better sound situation.  Rugs or some sort of sound barrier would help a lot. Also, we were one of a few tables but waited a long time. So long they brought an extra bruschetta (very nice of them!).

I'm from the East coast and it's hard to get a good pizza in AZ.  The pizzas at Lamp have fresh ingredients (basil, vegetables, meat, ricotta or mozzarella cheese) and the crust was thin.  Service was great and waitress was friendly and attentive.  Loved the pizza we had for late lunch and would go back for the dinner menu.  Have been to the Lamp Cafe next door and LOVE their salads!

ORDER: Mignulata for an appetizer (Sicilian Stuffed Bread) AND Geppetto (White pizza with sausage, gorgonzola & caramelized onion marmalade! Oh Em Gee! We substituted the cheese on the geppetto for ricotta and it was great! These two items on the menu are phenomenal! I won't branch out and try anything else! I had the ricotta cheesecake. It needed more citrus to cut the thickness of the cake. Next time I'll ask for more oranges. Go here, you will not be disappointed!

We love LAMP Pizzeria -  What a little gem in North Scottsdale.  We started with Italian glass of wine, ordered white bean and arugula salad (added some Proscuitto to the salad) and had side of their appetizer meatballs.  I'm Italian girl making meatballs the old fashion way for 30 years - OK...they were just like mine - Perfect.  The pizzia has the best crust and toppings - We have been back several times and are very happy every visit.  The wait staff is very friendly, but the best was the Owner, Lindsay took the time to talk to us and now knows us - so it is our new and most favorite place to go for salad, appetizers, and of course their amazing Pizza.  Lindsay's husband Matt makes the incredible Pizza.  Try it and you will be back.

When eating pizza, my girlfriend and I see absolutely no location as being off limits. I recently reviewed a nearby pizzeria and harshly criticized its pizza quality, declaring it as nothing more than a neighborhood restaurant whose praise stems mostly from the fact that there are no other options available in the area to compare it against.  In some ways, I expected similar things from Lamp Pizzeria. It's located off the beaten path, with a clientele that most likely consists of neighborhood locals. When I research pizza in Phoenix, Lamp is rarely mentioned or brought up as one of the premier "hot spots" for good pies. And honestly, I consider the term "hidden gem" to be one of the most overused terms in Yelp reviews. But this is one instance where I feel it just fits perfectly.  Lamp is a wood-fired pizzeria, very similar to the variety of well-known spots you'd find further south. And someway, somehow, Lamp manages to do things just as good, and even in some instances, actually better than some of these places.  My girlfriend and I have visited Lamp a handful of times over the last several years and have always been incredibly pleased with the results. Unlike one reviewer, who criticizes the "nook" table that's next to the restroom, we actually requested it during our most recent outing. I love the seclusion and privacy it provides. No, you can't see or hear anything that's happening in the restroom. In fact, I posted a picture of a seating area that I feel would be much, much more offensive to people that are picky about "restroom distance."  For starters, they offer a great fig and goat cheese bruchetta, as well as some decent zucchini cakes. The cakes have a crispy texture, very similar to what you'd find in a farinata. Additionally, their traditional bread offers up some surprisingly great flavor, making it an essential starter. Six dollars for olives is a bit silly, however, especially since they're complimentary at many other places. The ideal starter, however, is their mignulata, which is Sicilian bread stuffed with cauliflower, pecorino, and sausage.   One Yelp reviewer mentioned that they allow you to mix and match your pizzas. Keep in mind, this is only true in certain cases. Your reds will allow you a bit more flexibility in this area, whereas a white pizza like the Kensington requires you to order it whole due to the ingredients used. In fact, the Kensington is probably the best out of all of their creations, provided you're willing to pay for the prosciutto up-charge.   There's also an excellent Calabrian oil that you can order as a side. Be warned, however, that the spice in this is definitely not subtle. It hits your palette like a heel wrestler's chair-shot to the head. Pow! It works well on red pizzas, but again, up-charging for oil in a restaurant is the equivalent of charging for ketchup. But whatever.  Sticking with the positives, as I've said many times, it doesn't matter what you put on the pizza. If your crust sucks - your pizza sucks. And thankfully, Lamp knows what it's doing in this regard. Slightly charred with our preferred crunchy shell and moist interior, there's plenty of flavor packed in here. The Bianco influence is obvious.  For desserts, Lamp offers up a so-so ricotta cheesecake, some excellent shakes, and spectacular gelato - with their sea salt being our personal favorite. Their moist amaretti cookies (included with gelato) are so good that they can easily stand on their own as a respectable dessert.  Overall, this is probably one of the best examples of how a neighborhood pizzeria should operate. With great pizza, respectable starters, and some wonderfully simplistic dessert choices, you really can't go wrong.  It's a good 30-40 minute drive from my house - but as long as they keep doing things the way they're doing, we'll gladly make the occasional trip to Lamp to enjoy their delicious offerings.  Highly recommended!

Great food and a wonderful place for Pizza, fantastic salads, wine, beer.... the best pizza in Scottsdale by far.  Had to give it 4 stars because we went with a group and the waiter didn't tell us the tip was included so they walked away with a 44% tip... we should have known to look for this, however the Waiter knew as they had to add it on and should have said the tip is included....  The kicker and the Gem are our favorites and the Milkshakes are awesome (they even have adult milkshakes!)....  I am hopeful they fix the tipping issue as it is customary to tell the party that you have tacked on the tip!

My friend and I found this little gem on yelp! East coasters rejoice! Finally a pizza place that reminds us of home. We started our meal, the grape and Gorgonzola salad, it was crisp and fresh. Totally delicious. Ironically enough we got "The Gem" which has fresh ricotta, sausage and pepperoni! This pizza was perfect! I couldn't find any reason not to give this place five stars. Side note they accommodated us so we could watch the NBA finals!

LAMP is great restaurant all around.  The food is awesome, the atmosphere is lively and the wine is fantastic.  The pizza is some of the best pizza we have had.  It is very comparable to the pizza we get while visiting family in Italy.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. The pizza oven as the feature of the restaurant is very cool. But it all went downhill from there.  The staff were too busy shinning glasses to bother serving us and when they did finally get around to us they weren't all that helpful.   We ordered 3 different pizzas, we all liked the style but the flavor just wasn't there. They were sloppy and just blah.   Wine list was shocking also, so bad we didn't even order any and just stuck with water.

Definitely one of the best brick oven pizza's in Phoenix & it has the taste of  love all through it. The drive is a hike for me to get there (35 miles each way) however worth the time.  The bartender was fantastic!  Knows his stuff, every bite he recommended was on point and we never had to ask for a thing. And he was hammered with to go orders, bar customers, and the whole house of drink orders from the wait staff.  Truly a guy that knows how to run a bar!  Hard to find an over the top pizza and good service packaged so perfect. Top 2-3 Place in town!  I'm a pizza foodie and will be back. . . Even with the long drive I will become a regular!  This place has it all in Point!

I have been here a couple times, the red sangria is awesome.  The spinach salad was perfect, and their pizza's are great.  Will definitely be back again.  The service is fast and very friendly staff.  They really seem to care about the customer.
Very good pizza and salad. Pizza was crispy with fresh ingredients. Salad was large and had big chunks of shaved cheese. Good prices. Sangria was also very good. Nice atmosphere.
Best NY style pizza in town! Salads are good too. Very busy so call early for take-out.

I love Lamp Pizza. You cannot get a wood fired pizza like this in town. The "marginara" pizza we get is off the charts delicious. Their sauce and mozzarella is always fresh, and all of their employees are nice. The salads are also good, but a bit on the pricey side as well as the pizzas. My favorite pizza place in all of AZ by far! YUM

What happened to LAMP? Our recent visit was for a takeout salad and pizza.  The salad (arugula & bean) was good as usual, but the pizza (picked up on time and taken right home) was ice cold and the center of the crust was very soggy, yuck.  I tried to revive it in the oven but the outer crust had already been charred too much so it really didn't work out.   Also, my wife has complained of their roasted veg salad being way overcooked the last few times and now she has stopped ordering it. Lastly, did their pizzas get smaller?  Ever since they changed their pizza offerings, it seems they are now slightly smaller.  Hmmm. Too bad as we used to really like this place, having been there a couple of dozen times.  We will look for something else for a while and hope they get back on track.

It is always a pleasure to find a nice new restaurant up near Pinnacle Peak. We tried LAMP, and we were thoroughly satisfied!  The margherita with crimini mushrooms and sausage was excellent, and the grape/gorgonzola/pine nut salad was generous with a very tasty vinaigrette.  The staff were very attentive and it's obvious they care about their customers, their product and presentation. We're going back soon!  Give it a try. This is a tough area to make a small restaurant profitable, and we want to see this one stay a while!

Good experience, good food, good crowd on a Tuesday night. This is the place where locals go! James provided great service and great recommendations. Enjoyed the white pizza with sausage and a nice glass of red blend wine from Australia. Thanks for a great experience!
My finance and I are pizza obsessed and have tried nearly every place around. This is probably our new favorite !!! We can't wait to coke again. Simply amazing

OK this is a pizza place and a welcome addition to the North North Scottsdale culinary scene.  The salads are huge.... and tasty - perfectly dressed. The pizzas are terrific - the Gem and the Sargent are great. We tried the Gepetto the first time we were here...normally, I'm not a fan of white pizza, but it was excellent. Servers are a bit funky...the first night we were here, our server (who also works at X-Tapa Joes) was awesome. Last night, our server was just a little odd...but I couldn't fault the timely service and attention. Overall, a stellar experience.... Note that they only take reservations if your party has more than 6 in it.

Come on! This place is ridiculous!  I used to work at a country club right down the street and spent many an exhausted all-too-short break at the nearby Starbucks. I always thought Lamp's signage was cute and put it on my mental list of places to try.  Last night we decided to try some place new for our *1**year**anniversary* (Aw, a year ago we went on our first date and he thought I hated him the whole time) and Lamp was it. The menu looked tasty...but nothing could prepare me for the ...  CROSTINI. You must get this. You must. Toasty bread (next time I'll ask for a bit more char...I love grill marks on my bread! More flavah!) and onion/cheese-adorned flatbread wedges served along a trio of dips: Herbed Ricotta, White Bean/Roasted Red Pepper and (be still my heart) Rough Chop Pesto. The RCP was a flavor explosion of whole toasted pinenuts, fresh basil (in December? I like AZ), garlic, parm and magic. The herbed ricotta (It looked like a lil scoop of vanilla ice cream!) was a bit bland BUT, when combined with the RCP, it popped! The white bean/roasted red pep stood on it's own as well. This is one of my favorite appetizers of all time, hands down.  But what about the main event, the pizza? Two words: HOLY SAUCE. Both our pies were red sauced (Need to try the white pizza next time!) and it was pretty much a religious experience for me. Sauce was lightly done, as to not overpower anything, but it was SO fresh and homemade tasting. The Grandma had red chiles, onion and provolone (to die) and The Simple was a margherita topped with MOUNDS of arugula and fresh parm shavings with a sprinkling of extra virgin. They were both EXCELLENT.  Our server was sweet and kind of spastic, as we saw her run into about 3-4 tables, chairs, diners, etc. It was kind of funny.   Lamp is absolutely a new go-to! I LOVE LAMP! (Several years late, really cool reference points for me)

Love the wood fired pies here. They have a lovely selection of regular and white pizza. The salads are very nice as well. The atmosphere is nice with the pizza oven as the center piece. Try the kicker, vegtable and white pizze. The wine selection is nice. Ricotta cheesecake is  light and flavorful.  There are many pizzarias in the valley. This is right up there for quality.

Best pizza North of Cactus.  I can truly say that after eating more pizza than anyone over the last 50 years.  Meat balls are excellent too.  If you order food to be taken out on Friday.at 5pm expect to wait 1 hour 45 minutes so call early.

First time. Went for lunch. Very clean. Friendly host. Friendly server, Brook. I had the grape & Gorgonzola salad. It was delish! Fresh. Huge. Rich in flavor and texture. It comes w bread that was AMAZING. I only had a couple bites because I wanted to try the pizza. The crust was chewy in the best way possible. The pie itself could have used a pop of garlic or basil flavor to make it stand out. The service was awesome. Bathrooms very clean. Cool atmosphere. I bought a gift certificate for a friend. I'll definitely go back.

What can I say I'm a fan for good pizza.  I've been here twice now and both times I've been sat next to the restroom.  I don't usually mind it, but this place is small and the table setup isn't that spacious.  Sitting next within 5 feet of the restroom door you'll get a nice odor of urinal cake as a reminder.    Service was great though.  The sangria was tasting, but the caesar salad had too much anchovies in the dressing.  Still editable, but not your regular caesar.  The pizza!  We ordered the pepperoni and the kicker.  Both excellent choices, but one with a kick!  As you guessed the kicker had a nice spicy flavor.  Spicy Calabrian Peppers & Hot Calabrese Salami.    For dessert we order a Nutella Milkshake and a Amaretti Cookie Milkshake,  Both excellant!  For the price I think it's ok, but try not to get seated near the restroom.

This is the best pizza in town and the best food north of Bell road.  Everything is sooo yummy; no bad choices.  I moved back to AZ from LA a few months ago and my family is so grateful to have found Lamp. In addition to the food, the service is great. The staff get to know you and treat you like old friends. If you come here you will not be disappointed.  Also don't be turned off by the timing. Everything is worth it. Whatever time they quote you is 100% accurate; they have it down to a science.  Again, everything is worth it.
Good pizza, similar to pizzeria Bianco. Turns out my crust was a bit too gluteny chewy. Otherwise, delicious wood fired pizza

Check out this popular Pizzaria. Lamp is popular for a reason and one  of many is the spectacular thick deep mushroom pizza, and others! It's small and busy! It's our favorite since leaving Chicago to Scottsdale!

This place is by far, the BEST pizza I've ever had! It gets crowded but the service is great and they own the restaurant right next door (more of a Happy Hour Pizza Place) where you can hang out until they call your cell and tell you that your table is ready. Salads are BIG and delicious too. I had the Caesar Salad. We also had Pepperoni Pizza and a Veggie Pizza. Yum, yum yum!!!!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!
Absolutely my favorite pizza spot in the valley. I've been coming here over the past 4 years and each time, without fail, is the best pizza I've had. Matt and his staff know what they are doing!

I can't rave enough about this place. I've tried many items on the menu, including apps, pizza, salads and desserts. They are all fantastic. This is the best pizza in town hands down!! Pizzeria Bianco who?

This is wood oven fired pizza at it's BEST!  The dough was thin, crispy and yet obtained a slight doughy chew, with a bubbly, gorgeous crust. The dough, in an of itself, was the perfect combination of textures and taste. The toppings on the pizza were flavorful and unique. We ordered the "Sidekick" pizza and Spinach salad. The Salad was super fresh with a high quality extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinagrette, which could stand alone on their own merit.  Adding extra levels of deliciousness, the salad also included fresh orange slices, pine nuts and goat cheese, as well as two fresh pieces of italian bread. My husband, who is not a salad fan, said he would gladly eat salad every day if it tasted this good. Every aspect of our meal was composed of fresh, high quality ingredients that were perfectly balanced together!  We can not wait to come back and try more dishes!  Our waiter was very friendly, professional and attentive, also.  Across the courtyard from LAMP Pizzeria, is LAMP CAFE, which we can not wait to try.  The menu and decor there, looked very appealing, as well.

Have gone several times for pick up and have decided not to go back. Food is delicious but the wait times are just ridiculous, maybe invest in another pizza oven? Making your customer wait 2 hours and then telling them it's going to be an additional 30 minutes when they go pick it up is just crazy. The staff aren't friendly, particularly the bar tender. Won't be back, plenty of good pizza around here without dealing with this crap.

Fantastic. Love every bit of it. The soup is a great appetizer, as well as the Cesar salad. We got 4 pizzas, the Gem, the scientist, the Marghinara and a Margherita pizza. All were delicious. Would recommend this pizza place over any other in Arizona. The wood baked oven for all to see while eating is also really cool.

Love the pizza and salads here! My 10 year old is a big fan too - the style of pizza, variety of ingredients and toppings, quality and taste - all get two thumbs up! The guy behind the bar that also helps with takeout orders is awesome - super friendly and helpful. Try to avoid the peak dinner times and be prepared for a bit of a wait when all the snowbirds are in town. Snowbirds... lol. They love this place.

The menu looks appealing. Getting "The Gem" red pizza today. Looks like there are14 reds and 7 or 8 white pizzas. The restaurant is small and the staff is very friendly. They have a wood fired stove that the owner works and really do a great pizza.

A friend of the family recommended this place so we decided to check it out.   When the 7 of us arrived the restaurant was almost entirely full (it's not very large in there; I would suggest making reservations for larger groups). They apologized and said they didn't have the space and there would be a wait.  Luckily, a table had just stood up to leave and they were able to push a couple tables together to accommodate us.  The restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly and attentive. We ordered five different kinds of pizza. Three of which I tried; "The Scientist", "Geppetto" and "Wood Roasted Mushroom". By far the Geppetto was my favorite. I also enjoyed the large fresh mushrooms on the Wood Roasted Mushroom Pizza. The crust was a little too burnt for my taste (I pulled the crust off to get ready for swim suit season anyway!) but otherwise the pizza was delicious. We had assumed we would take some left overs home but it was so good we ate everything that came of out their wood fire (which you can see from almost anywhere in the restaurant).  Overall it was very good and I think I will go back with just my husband to have an easy date night!

We arrived at Lamp at 7:30,  we ordered at 7:40,  our pizza's arrived at  8:45.  Who goes to a pizza joint to wait over an hour for food?  As usual fairly brusk service and no reason for the wait.  If you want to wait over an hour for an expensive pizza, less than average service and the smallest wine pour in Scottsdale go to Lamp.  Two pizzas, and a few drinks at over $85 is not my idea of a pizza night out.  Go at your own risk and time.
A very solid pizza and salad joint with good service and a nice ambiance.  Check it out, your will not be disappointed.

Went to Lamp Pizzeria for the first time this week and can't wait to go back. Had the meatballs to start and was blown away. They were incredible!  The pizza too, was awesome. Everything is fresh and even their Sicilian sausage was homemade!  The crust is perfect as only a wood fired crust can be. The salads are large and couldn't be fresher. So many to choose from too. Matt, the owner and pizza maker is right on with one. His hard work and research on each meal he puts out really shows. Our waiter, Zack truly made our experience at Lamp a great one. He answered our questions, made suggestions and had a great personality. There are so many items on the menu that I want to try that, as I said, I can't wait to go back and bring family and friends too. Keep up the good work. This is a winner!
I'm from NYC and was visiting my family. This place is now my favorite over anything I've tried back home. Bravo~

Amazing!!! Great option for lunch and dinner. Appetizers are unique and quite tasty. Same simple salad from next door. Sea Salt and Carmel gelato is a must. Lamp pizza and Lamp cafe are as close to Italy as you're going to get without crossing the pond. A++

By far the coziest restaurant in North Scottsdale, with food and service to match. The owner and staff are little gems. I have tried many of their pizzas and all of them beyond satisfied my taste buds.  I am very impressed by Lamp Pizzeria and have no doubt that they will be very successful. It is the personality of the owner that shines through the great flavorful food.  Yes, I am somewhat addicted to this place but it's easy to understand why and I am confident that it will become one of your favorite restaurants to savor a delicious artisan pizza.  You also must try the mignulata. one of the best appetizers I have ever had. I will not describe it here, just go and have some!

Wood fired pizza with meats from Defalcos, what more could you possibly want?   With my ancestors from Calabria, my heart, along with my taste buds, were warmed by the Kicker, which features Calabrian salami and hot oil. The Nutella shake as a desert was also a nice European-styled touch! Will be returning soon!

Ordered the Pom Pom....very good.  Crust was perfect on the outside but a little soggy in the center of the pie...not too bad though.  My favorite part was the salad...the basic salad...can't remember the name.  It reminded me of the homemade salad you would get in South Philly.  Service was excellent....our server Nick was very nice and attentive.  And kudos to LAMP for offering GOOD (Clausthaler) non-alcoholic beer.  It is nice to have that choice when you want to have beer with your pizza but you have to drive home.  My only negatives are the the noise level and the LOUD bartender.  Hard to have a conversation with your companions.  Will I be back?  Of course!  I need more of that salad!

If, for some reason, you'd like to order a pizza with figs on it, but find yourself deathly afraid to take the leap, I recommend the Kensington.  Let's just say I've had a few billion variations of fig pizza in my day (I'll explain later/never.) Anyway, LAMP's Kensington was like fig 'n' goat cheese for  newbs - mostly mozzarella, blessed with a couple speckles of weak goat cheese and bits of fig. The crust was decent, but not memorable. Aside from arugula, I was yearning for more flavor than I got.   It think there's a lot of potential, but 'm not rushing back any time soon unless I can get about 5x the toppings and flavor, squared.

Neighborhood Gem! Don't eat pizza very often but when we do we come to  Lamp pizzeria!!! Excellent salads and pizza from the wood-burning oven's.  Fresh, fresh, fresh!! Always busy !! Usually sit in the bar area with James the bartender who is  always entertaining.   However a full  restaurant last night we were dining at the bar area. We would have stayed longer for another glass of wine  but with the sweat dripping down our backs ...we had to go. Can someone please turn the AC up in there?!
I can't believe I'm going to say this. I think the salami and olive pizza I just ate might be the best ever. Wow!

Love this place. Most of the time my husband and I grab food for take out after work and they are awesome. Love their pizza and salad selection. Tried different types and they are all good. Glad they are located by our house.

Great pizza.  A little bigger than a personal pizza but definitely not a medium sized pizza.  Price being $12 to $16 for 2 or 3 ingredients.  Wood oven, everything fresh and tasty, just a little pricey, but it's Scottsdale, in the same shopping center as Mastro's.  There is a zucchini cake appetizer that is a must have. It is three zucchini cakes that are similar to crab cakes.  The flavors and textures are perfect. We had a large Caesar salad which was easily large enough to split. Excellent service. Didn't give it five stars because it is a tad pricey for the pizza.

I love this place!  My friend Bill told me they had the best pizza and he was right.  Wow - I don't know what it is - their oven or the ingredients, but I've tried almost all their pizzas now and each one is just ridiculously good!  I can't comment on the other food....since I can't get past their pizza and a glass or two of wine to go with it.  The people are friendly and it's really nice looking inside.  A good date spot I think, and cool for families too.  I don't want to overstate it, but their pizza is so good - if you eat pizza somewhere else you feel guilty.  Thanks LAMP Pizzeria!
Yum yum! What else is their to say that everyone else hasnt said about this place. I'm probably the biggest pizza fanatic in phoenix - it's literally all I eat, every meal.   Very impressed!

Molto Bene!  My hubby and I enjoyed lunch at this fun find over the holidays.  I was surprised at how packed this place was considering obligations of the holidays.  We fell for the reviews and supped on the Gem-topped with the perfect amount of ingredients so as to keep it light and crispy-and the Grape and Gorgonzola Salad-a refreshing pairing.  The only downside was the gorgonzola was very mild-almost seeming like a goat cheese.  I love a strong, creamy gorg-and this was not the case. Oh well-everything else was just what my appetite desired.

Pizza is good.. it just I waited for another 15 to mins because they mess up my pizza. The waitress said they made a whole on my pizza...  I still want to give them 5 stars because of the owners. They responded to me right away when they learned about the issue. I have to give them credit for the excellent care and attention they give to their  customers. Thank you!..
Decent pizzeria nearby.  It won't necessarily be in high rotation, but the atmosphere was nice and the food was good.

We ate here for lunch today and liked it pretty well. The pizza was very good. We also had a toasted marshmallow milkshake and a tomato basil mozzarella salad. The Salad was not what I was expecting, but I liked it a lot. We customized our pizza order and they did half and half for us, which was nice. the crust was delicious. They could have been more generous with the mushrooms and olives but I could tell the ingredients were high quality. The toasted marshmallow milkshake was decent. I could not decide between 3 and 4 stars, but the service was very good so I went with 4. Thanks!

I have been to Lamp twice now. Both experiences were great and here's why:  First trip we sat in the bar area and the bartender, James, waited on us. Very nice guy, easy to talk to, knew the menu well and gave us plenty of attention when the food arrived and drinks needed some refills.  I hate to say it but both trips to Lamp we ordered the same exact thing. Margherita Pizza and the Grape and gorgonzola Salad (i think that's what it's called). We had to get them again because they are so so good. The salad isn't covered in dressing and comes with the appropriate amount of grapes, gorgonzola and other toppings. Oh! It also comes with some bread, delicious.  The pizza is also very good. Crust is thin and delicious, great ratio of cheese/sauce and it's the perfect size to split between two people.  This is a great local sit down and order some good pizza kinda place. We will definitely be back and maybe this time try something new.

The place was very good! Yummy salad, bread (plain and sausage), and pizza. The atmosphere is super dark and trendy; perfect for a date. Grimaldi's is my place to go for pizza which I would go to if I had a bigger party due to the option to have a bigger pizza. I would go to LAMP on a date night. Nothing wrong with the food, very delicious all around. The reason why I don't give it 5 stars is because our meal was very rushed. 3 separate courses yet we were in and out within an hour which took away from a great restaurant experience.

Awesome pizza and fast take out, if it isn't during the busy hours! Wood fired crust, quality cheese. Very tasty! The larges are smallish. Big enough for 1-2 people. Excellent and the service was great! Fast, when I walked in 10 min after ordering, our pizzas were hot and ready along with the check. We will be back.

LAMP, the pizza place with a strange name and amazing pizza. The freshness of the ingredients and the creativity of the combinations of toppings leave no need to "create your own". Tonight was my second visit for dinner, and it doesn't much get better than sitting on the patio sipping a fruit-filled white sangria while splitting a grape and gorgonzola salad, and a Gem pizza (sausage, pepperoni, basil, and ricotta). Plenty of food for two average people, and delicious doesn't cover it.   Our server was always attentive even though we were the only ones seated outside, and our four-top lingered long after the check just talking and sipping waters.   The inside of the restaurant is cozy with romantic vibe of low lighting. The smells that comes from that kitchen are as amazing as the perfect pizza. I definitely recommend this to anyone craving a well-crafted meal!

Got the Gordon pizza which was delicious with perfect texture and crispy crust! The veggie red sauce pizza was good but soggy. The atmosphere is nice but really loud. I would definitely come here again and before the busy crowd hours if I wanted to hear the conversation.

I'm a crazy enough pizza fan to have built my own wood burning oven in the backyard. Suffice it to say, it is a lot of work making your own pies. I've been wanting to try Lamp out for awhile. We had the tessoro pie and thought it was delicious. I'm all about flavor in the dough, and I got hints of the delicious dough about every other bite. The most flavorful part for me was just before you hit the crust, the flavor of the dough pops in your mouth. And the sauce is nice and bright. The salted carmel gelato was great as well, along with the cookies that accompany it.  Best of all, the owner Matt, is super friendly, loves to make pizza and it shows. We had great conversation about pizza, toppings, sauces, dough, etc all while he kept cranking out the pies. Many of the pizza shops in town, the owner isn't around or not working the oven. If one opens a pizza shop cause they love pizza, I expect that owner to be making the pies, since I believe it's most critical. You can't hand over the reins to the dough, pizza, oven to some employee who doesn' thave the feel of the dough, or understand how to cook the pizzas properly.

As an Italian from New Jersey with multiple restaurant chefs in the family I don't know what others are eating here that has given this place such rave reviews. We started with the Fig-Sambuca Bruschetta which the presentation was great and it was very tasty but spreading out the cheese over the figs really improved the flavor since the way it is served you get a bite of cheese and then the second bite is fig no cheese. The combination of fig with cheese is much better. We then had the Margarita pizza which was bland, bland crust just pretty much tasteless, nothing memorable. Doubt we will be back.

The husband and I picked up a pizza and salad from here for dinner the other week. Both were outstanding. And we eat a lot of pizza and a lot of salads. Neapolitan isn't our favorite style but this was excellent. The salad was really simple and high quality. Even though it's outside of our 10 minute drive bubble, we'll be back.
This place is terrific!  Great service, fun, both red & white pizza's were delicious!  Truly recommend.
